articles.author: TIFFANY STANLEY
articles.description: DOVER, Del. (AP) — It was her last day in session as a Delaware state senator, and Sarah McBride sat in her tiny office at the state Capitol, preparing farewell remarks.She had made history here, as the first openly transgender state senator in the country.
articles.title: Transgender trailblazer Sarah McBride heads to her debut in Congress, hoping for a touch of grace

articles.author: ALEX VEIGA
articles.description: Stock indexes closed mostly lower Tuesday as the market delivered a downbeat finish on the final day of another milestone-shattering year on Wall Street.The S&P 500 gave up an early gain to finish down 0.4%.
articles.title: Stock market today: Wall Street indexes lose ground as market closes another record-breaking year

articles.author: DAVID KLEPPER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The United States has imposed sanctions on two groups linked to Iranian and Russian efforts to target American voters with disinformation ahead of this year's election.
articles.title: US imposes sanctions on Russian and Iranian groups over disinformation targeting American voters

articles.author: CHARLOTTE GRAHAM-McLAY
articles.description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand (AP) — From Sydney to Mumbai to Nairobi, communities around the world began welcoming 2025 with spectacular light shows, embraces and ice plunges.
articles.title: The world begins welcoming 2025 with light shows, embraces and ice plunges

articles.author: GHAITH ALSAYED, WAFAA SHURAFA and LUJAIN JO
articles.description: DAMASCUS (AP) — In Damascus, the streets were buzzing with excitement Tuesday as Syrians welcomed in a new year that seemed to many to bring a promise of a brighter future after the unexpected fall of Bashar Assad’s government weeks earlier.
articles.title: A new year dawns on a Middle East torn by conflict and change

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — The cars begin lining up early in the morning to be screened by Secret Service agents under white tents near the fence that surrounds President-elect Donald Trump’s vast south Florida estate.
articles.title: Trump calls it the 'center of the universe.' Mar-a-Lago is a magnet for those seeking influence

articles.author: HYUNG-JIN KIM
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — A team of U.S. investigators including representatives from Boeing on Tuesday examined the site of a plane crash that killed 179 people in South Korea while authorities were conducting safety inspections on all Boeing 737-800 aircraft operated by the country’s airlines.
articles.title: US and Boeing investigators examine the site of a deadly South Korean plane crash

articles.author: FARAI MUTSAKA and CHRISTINA A. CASSIDY
articles.description: HARARE, Zimbabwe (AP) — Amid everything else on his desk — the Iran hostage crisis, domestic economic turmoil, the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan and a grueling 1980 reelection fight — President Jimmy Carter elevated the independence of a country in southern Africa as a top agenda item.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter sought to expand democracy worldwide long after he left the White House

articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The woman who died after being set on fire in a New York subway train this month was a 57-year-old from New Jersey, police announced Tuesday.
articles.title: Woman burned to death in New York subway is identified as 57-year-old from New Jersey

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A military appeals court has ruled against Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin's effort to throw out the plea deals reached for Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and two other defendants in the 9/11 attacks, a U.S.
articles.title: The Pentagon chief loses bid to reject 9/11 plea deals
